tool_description: An API that gathers basic information about each monster in the franchise, not including spin offs.
name: Monster Hunter Basic Information
title: Monster Hunter Basic Information

api_list.name: First Generation
api_list.description:
Gathers the monsters from Monster Hunter, Monster Hunter G, and Monster Hunter Freedom. 

Available endpoints are "smallmonsters" and "largemonsters". 

Leaving the monster type blank will get all monsters from this generation.

required_parameters.name: monsterType
required_parameters.description:
User \"smallmonsters\" or \"largemonsters\" to get those specific monsters. Leaving this field blank will gather all monsters in this generation. 
You can also search for one monster by doing: \"mh_first/search/{yourTargetMonster}

api_list.name: Search
api_list.description: Allows the gathering of one specific monster from the franchise. Every other endpoint. Search within one generation is also possible through their specific endpoints. Searching for a monster through a specific generation endpoint is likely to yield faster results.

api_list.name: First Generation Search
api_list.description: Search for a monster from Monster Hunter, Monster Hunter G, and Monster Hunter Freedom.

api_list.name: Fourth Generation Search
api_list.description: Search for a monster from Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate and Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate.

api_list.name: Second Generation Search
api_list.description: Search for a monster from Monster Hunter 2, Monster Hunter Freedom 2, and Monster Hunter Freedom Unite.

api_list.name: Fourth Generation
api_list.description:
Gathers the monsters from Monster Hunter 4, Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate, Monster Hunter Generations, and Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate. 

Available endpoints are "smallmonsters" and "largemonsters". 

Leaving the monster type blank will get all monsters from this generation.

required_parameters.name: monsterType
required_parameters.description:
User \"smallmonsters\" or \"largemonsters\" to get those specific monsters. Leaving this field blank will gather all monsters in this generation. 
You can also search for one monster by doing: \"mh_first/search/{yourTargetMonster}

api_list.name: Third Generation Search
api_list.description: Search for a monster from Monster Hunter 3, Monster Hunter Portable 3rd, and Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate.

api_list.name: Fifth Generation Search
api_list.description: Use this endpoint to search for a specific monster that appeared in Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbreak or Monster Hunter World: Iceborne

api_list.name: Fifth Generation
api_list.description:
Gathers the monsters from Monster Hunter World: Iceborne and Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbreak.

Available endpoints are "smallmonsters" and "largemonsters". 

Leaving the monster type blank will get all monsters from this generation.

required_parameters.name: monsterType
required_parameters.description:
User \\\\\\\"smallmonsters\\\\\\\" or \\\\\\\"largemonsters\\\\\\\" to get those specific monsters. Leaving this field blank will gather all monsters in this generation. 
You can also search for one monster by doing: \\\\\\\"mh_first/search/{yourTargetMonster}

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monster-hunter-basic-information.p.rapidapi.com/mh_fifth/smallmonsters"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monster-hunter-basic-information.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://monster-hunter-basic-information.p.rapidapi.com/mh_fifth/{monstertype}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monster-hunter-basic-information.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
